import { Typography } from "@material-ui/core"; import * as React from "react" import './main.css'; const Hashtags = () => { return (
Hashtag Activism Overview This was the final project for CS1951A: Data Science at Brown University, for which I worked in a group to extract, process, analyze and create visualizations of data of our own choosing to answer a research question. This culminated in a poster, which we presented at the end of the semester. Introduction / Context Hashtag activism has become an increasingly common way to fuel social movements. We wanted to explore where real-life events and social media come together by analyzing how events impact hashtag interaction on Twitter. Data
  • Counts: We are using the counts endpoint of the Twitter Full Archive Search API to collect the number of tweets per day that contain one of the given hashtags.
  • Events: To create our Events dataset, we selected 20 events for each movement from our research, 10 of which are categorized as “triggering” (shootings, scandals, etc) and the other 10 categorized as “activism” (marches, protests).
  • Movements: We selected three social movements to focus our project on and created a table including data (such as the time range and associated hashtags) about each one.
); } export default Hashtags;
